intro: Microtropis guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan microtropis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in yellow or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
